topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Pausing and Un-pausing Instances

body.p: When a user pauses an instance, the instance remains running, but, in a frozen state. The contents of the instance are stored in memory (RAM). Memory and vCPUs are not released.
Users can suspend an instance, for example, in order to make a back up of an instance to prevent the instance from being used during the process.
Note: Pausing is different from suspending an instance. Suspending stops the instance, stores the contents on the disk. the memory and vCPUs become available to create other instances.
body.section:
Pause an instance
To pause an instance:
Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Instances tab.
In the Instances table, for the instance you want to pause, click Edit Instance > Pause Instance.
The status of the instance reports *Paused*.Note that many of the commands on the More menu are not available for a paused instance.

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Instances tab.

In the Instances table, for the instance you want to unpause, click Edit Instance > Unpause Instance.
Note that all of the commands on the More menu are available.
